Sentencas: Grading the porous anode microstructure, i.e., gradient anode is an effective way to enhance the electrical performance of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Modeling and optimizing of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells with gradient anode: Part I. Model description and validation by experiments

Sentencas: This article is the first part of a two-part article which presents a 3D numerical model of a gradient anode SOFC and conducts a model validation in comparison with the experiments for the gradient anode SOFC modeling and optimizing.
Titulo: Modeling and optimizing of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells with gradient anode: Part I. Model description and validation by experiments

Sentencas: An experimental test setup was constructed first to evaluate the electrical performance of a SOFC button cell with a gradient anode.

Sentencas: Then the microstructure characterization of each cell component was obtained by combining the mercury porosimetry with image analysis.

Sentencas: Based on the microstructure parameters and measured electrical performances, the numerical model of the gradient anode SOFC button cell was established, which related the cell microstructure to the electrochemical characteristics.
